prompt.details: Basic info about your prompt: title, role, and structure.
prompt.role: Defines who the AI should act as (e.g., Expert Developer).
prompt.goal: The main objective or task you want the AI to accomplish.
prompt.context: Background information, constraints, or environment details.
prompt.inputs: Data or variables the AI needs to process (e.g., code, text).
prompt.constraints: Rules, limits, and negative constraints (what NOT to do).
prompt.output-format: How the result should look (JSON, Markdown, Table).
prompt.examples: One or more examples to guide the AI's style and reasoning.

skill.packInfo: Define the pack's identity and visibility.
skill.skillList: Manage skills in this pack. Select one to edit.
skill.markdown: The reusable markdown content. Use {{variables}} for dynamic inputs.

agent.identity: The agent's name and high-level role.
agent.objective: What is the agent's primary purpose?
agent.inputs: Define what information the agent needs to start.
agent.steps: The step-by-step plan the agent should follow.
agent.tools: Select tools the agent can use (metadata only).
agent.policies: Rules and guidelines the agent must follow.
agent.outputContract: Strict definition of the final output format.
agent.attachSkills: Include skills from your local packs.

landing.title: Visual builder for prompts, skills and agents without being an expert
landing.subtitle: Drag blocks, follow step 1 / step 2 / step 3 and export ready-to-use text. No API keys, no model execution.

prompt.title: What is a Prompt?
prompt.description: Clear instructions so a model answers exactly how you need.

skill.title: What is a Skill?
skill.description: A reusable Markdown block that teaches how to do a task.
skill.step1: Step 1: Create skills in a pack.

agent.title: What is an Agent?
agent.description: A text-first agent design: role, objective, steps, tools and output contract.

structures.title: Recommended structures
structures.description: Learn frameworks like RTF, TAO, BAB, CARE and more.

builders.title: Ready-to-use builders
builders.description: Drag & drop canvas for non-experts with live preview.

landing.differentialDesc: Built for beginners with visual-first UX.
landing.diff1: Canvas drag & drop + 3 modules (Prompt / Skill / Agent) with non-expert UX.
landing.diff2: Skill Builder exports packs as folders with SKILL.md.
landing.diff3: Agent Builder exports AGENTS.md + skills/ bundle.

promptBuilder.title: Prompt Builder
promptBuilder.subtitle: Build prompts piece by piece in a Trello-like canvas.
promptBuilder.step1: Step 1: Drag blocks from the palette.
promptBuilder.step2: Step 2: Edit each block in the canvas.
promptBuilder.step3: Step 3: Copy or export final prompt.
promptBuilder.canvasHelp: Droppable columns: Role, Goal, Context, Inputs, Constraints, Output Format, Examples.
promptBuilder.stepsDescription: Follow these steps and complete each one before publishing.
promptBuilder.noSuggestedBlocks: No suggested blocks for this step.
promptBuilder.inputsEmpty: Starter suggestion: describe expected user inputs here or drag a block from the palette.

skillBuilder.title: Skill Builder
skillBuilder.subtitle: Create Markdown skill packs exportable with SKILL.md.
skillBuilder.empty: No skills yet. Create the first one.
skillBuilder.editorHelp: Fill Purpose / When to use / Steps / Examples / Output contract.
skillBuilder.defaultMarkdown:
## Purpose

## When to use

## Steps

## Examples

## Output contract
skillBuilder.stepsDescription: Define the pack, add skills, and edit reusable content.

agentBuilder.title: Agent Builder
agentBuilder.subtitle: Design a conceptual agent and export ready-to-use text.
agentBuilder.noSkills: No local skills available to attach.
agentBuilder.outputContractDefault: JSON with keys: summary, actions, risks
agentBuilder.howToUse3: Validate the result with the output contract.
agentBuilder.stepsDescription: Complete each section to generate a clear agent for non-experts.

gallery.title: Public Gallery
gallery.subtitle: Public prompts in read-only mode.
gallery.notFoundDesc: It may be hidden or not exist.

auth.title: Login / Register
auth.subtitle: Email + password (MVP 0.1)
auth.disabled: Auth disabled: configure Supabase to enable login.

structuresPage.title: Prompt Structures
structuresPage.subtitle: Simple templates to write clear prompts.

buildersHub.title: Builders
buildersHub.subtitle: Pick the builder you need and start in a few steps.
buildersHub.promptDesc: Drag & drop canvas to build prompts from blocks.
buildersHub.skillDesc: Create skill packs with exportable SKILL.md.
buildersHub.agentDesc: Design text-based agents and export AGENTS.md + bundle.

blocks.devWebRoleContent: Act as a senior Full-Stack Developer for web apps.
blocks.devWebGoalContent: Build responsive web interface with accessibility standards.
blocks.devWebContextContent: Modern web stack with React/Next.js and TypeScript.
blocks.devBackendContent: Design scalable backend architecture with clear steps.
blocks.devBackendConstraintsContent: Follow REST principles, use PostgreSQL, handle auth securely.
blocks.devBackendExamplesContent: Reference: Express.js API with JWT auth and rate limiting.
blocks.devMobileRoleContent: Act as a senior Mobile Developer for iOS/Android.
blocks.devMobileGoalContent: Create native mobile experience with smooth animations.
blocks.devDevOpsRoleContent: Act as a DevOps Engineer specializing in CI/CD.
blocks.devDevOpsGoalContent: Automate deployment pipeline with zero-downtime releases.
blocks.devDbRoleContent: Act as a Database Architect for data modeling.
blocks.devDbOutputContent: SQL schema with indexes, constraints, and migration scripts.
blocks.devApiRoleContent: Act as an API Designer following OpenAPI standards.
blocks.devApiConstraintsContent: RESTful, versioned, paginated, with clear error codes.
blocks.imagePhotoContent: Write prompts for photo-real images with lighting and lens.
blocks.imagePhotoGoalContent: Generate photorealistic image with specific mood and composition.
blocks.imagePhotoConstraintsContent: Natural lighting, 50mm lens, shallow depth of field, golden hour.
blocks.imageUiContent: Create UI mock brief with layout, hierarchy and style.
blocks.imageUiGoalContent: Design clean dashboard interface with data visualization.
blocks.imageIllustrationRoleContent: Act as an Illustrator creating vector graphics.
blocks.imageIllustrationContextContent: Flat design style for tech startup branding.
blocks.imageLogoGoalContent: Create minimalist logo representing innovation and trust.
blocks.imageLogoConstraintsContent: Monochrome, scalable, works at 16x16px, no text.
blocks.videoCinematicContent: Short cinematic script with pacing, shots and tone.
blocks.videoCinematicContextContent: Noir style, urban setting, suspenseful atmosphere.
blocks.videoAdsContent: Ad storyboard with hook, benefit and CTA.
blocks.videoTutorialRoleContent: Act as a Tutorial Creator for educational content.
blocks.videoTutorialGoalContent: Explain complex concept in under 5 minutes with visuals.
blocks.videoShortsGoalContent: Create viral-worthy 60-second short with strong hook.
blocks.videoShortsConstraintsContent: Vertical format, captions, trending audio, fast cuts.

tools.webSearchDesc: Find updated info on the web.
tools.imageAnalyzerDesc: Analyze images for description or visual QA.
tools.apiCallerDesc: Make HTTP requests to external APIs.
tools.dbQueryDesc: Execute database queries and return results.
tools.emailSenderDesc: Send emails with templates and attachments.
tools.pdfReaderDesc: Extract text and data from PDF documents.
tools.chartGeneratorDesc: Create charts and visualizations from data.

rtf.title: Role / Task / Format
rtf.whatIs: RTF separates who speaks, what to do and how to deliver. It is the easiest structure to start with.
rtf.when1: When you need clear direct answers.
rtf.when2: When final format matters (table, list, JSON).
rtf.when3: When you want less ambiguity from the start.
rtf.example:
Role: You are a QA Analyst.
Task: Evaluate 5 edge cases for login.
Format: Numbered list with risk and priority.

tao.title: Task / Action / Output
tao.whatIs: TAO defines the objective, expected process and exact output for better execution control.
tao.when1: When you need a guided workflow.
tao.when2: When there are multiple intermediate actions.
tao.example:
Task: Create refactor plan.
Action: Analyze modules, detect debt, prioritize.
Output: Table with impact, effort and suggested order.

bab.title: Before / After / Bridge
bab.whatIs: BAB compares current vs desired state and defines the bridge to get there.
bab.template:
Before: [current state]
After: [desired state]
Bridge: [actions from A to B]
bab.example:
Before: Team needs 3 days to document tickets.
After: Clear tickets in under 30 min.
Bridge: Fixed template, checklist and quick review.

care.title: Context / Action / Result / Examples
care.whatIs: CARE adds examples to stabilize quality and style of the output.
care.template:
Context: [context]
Action: [what to do]
Result: [expected result]
Examples: [references]
care.example:
Context: Online course launch.
Action: Create 3 landing page copies.
Result: Persuasive copy by segment.
Examples: Clear style, strong CTA, max 80 words.

costar.title: Context / Objective / Style / Tone / Audience / Response
costar.whatIs: CO-STAR gives tight control over intention and voice across audiences.
costar.template:
Context: [situation]
Objective: [objective]
Style: [style]
Tone: [tone]
Audience: [audience]
Response: [response type]
costar.example:
Context: Fitness app launch.
Objective: Increase signups.
Style: Direct and useful.
Tone: Motivational.
Audience: Busy people 25-40.
Response: 5 short ads.

crispe.title: Capacity / Role / Insight / Statement / Personality / Experiment
crispe.whatIs: CRISPE is useful for strategic or creative work where personality and experimentation are explicit.
crispe.when2: When you need hypotheses and experiments.
crispe.template:
Capacity: [capabilities]
Role: [role]
Insight: [key data]
Statement: [thesis/goal]
Personality: [voice style]
Experiment: [test/variations]
crispe.example:
Capacity: Growth strategist.
Role: Senior consultant.
Insight: CTR dropped 18%.
Statement: Recover CTR in 14 days.
Personality: Practical and concise.
Experiment: 3 subject line + CTA variants.

star.title: Situation / Task / Action / Result
star.whatIs: STAR builds problem-to-solution narratives, useful for cases and retrospectives.
star.example:
Situation: Support overloaded with repeated tickets.
Task: Reduce tickets by 30%.
Action: Knowledge base + response macros.
Result: -35% tickets in 3 weeks.
